note.p: Letter not found; item is a register entry only, dated 11 February 1885, of a letter dated 9 February.

p.seg: [Secy of State Extract from letter Director Kew Gardens — on formation of "Herbaria".]

p.style: margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; text-align: start; hyphenation-ladder-count: no-limit; hyphenate: false; hyphenation-remain-char-count: 2; hyphenation-push-char-count: 2; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-family: Geneva; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: This letter was returned to M on 18 February minuted: 'Retain copy'. M referred the letter back to the Chief Secretary on 26 February and it was forwarded to the Premier's Department on 5 March. This letter should be in the Premier’s Department files at PRO. It is possible that it is not filed under M but under Secretary of State or Dyer from Kew. It is definitely worth looking for.
